title: Advancing In-Situ Sample Preparation for MEMS-Based Electrical and Electro-Thermal (S)TEM Characterization
content: We present a novel and refined focused ion beam (FIB)-based methodology tailored for the fabrication of clean and artifact-free specimens attached on micro-electro-mechanical-system (MEMS)-based chips for in-situ electrical and electro-thermal experiments in a (scanning) transmission electron microscope ((S)TEM). Although FIB instruments are routinely used to prepare TEM samples, they often introduce damage and contamination that can have a significant undesired effect on the electrical properties of the samples under investigation. In-situ sample preparation on MEMS chips is more challenging as it involves extraction of lamellae from the bulk sample, a transfer to the MEMS device, and final thinning to electron transparency.
